definition: vulture/(bird species of China) cinereous vulture (Aegypius monachus)

sentences.english: They're the most cooperative and the most social of all vultures.
sentences.chinese: 在禿鷲中，它們的協作性與社會化程度是最好的。

sentences.english: Nothing gets vultures squawking louder with delight than a wave of forced selling.
sentences.chinese: 只有被迫出售才能是這些禿鷲發出愉快的叫聲。

sentences.english: We saw a vulture gorging on some rotting carcase.
sentences.chinese: 我們看見一隻禿鷲正在貪婪地啄食腐屍。

sentences.english: A cluster of vultures crouched on the carcass of a dead buffalo .
sentences.chinese: 一羣禿鷲蹲伏在一具野牛的屍體上。

sentences.english: One example is the California condor.
sentences.chinese: 有一個加利福尼亞禿鷲的例子。

sentences.english: Let 's befriends, or we' ll be the food of the vultultures.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們成爲朋友吧，不然我們會變成禿鷲們的食物。

sentences.english: Which means the vultures have an entire fresh kongoni carcass all to themselves.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着禿鷲完全擁有了一具新鮮的東非狷羚屍體。

sentences.english: The vultures try to move in and are prevented by waving sticks and shouts.
sentences.chinese: 禿鷲們再一次試圖靠近但被揮舞的棍棒和吆喝聲驅趕。
但是禿鷲也有自己的用武之地。

sentences.english: The vultures come to save Mowgli.
This is the Ruppell's Griffon Vulture.
sentences.chinese: 這是一隻魯氏粗毛禿鷲。

sentences.english: You will see many Twilight Buzzards flying around.
sentences.chinese: 這周圍有不少的暮光禿鷲。

sentences.english: A complete comparison on skeleton of Andean condor and cinereous vulture was carried out.
sentences.chinese: 對康多兀鷲和禿鷲骨骼進行了系統地比較。

sentences.english: The vultures are afraid but Mowgli is not afraid.
sentences.chinese: 禿鷲們很害怕，但是無忌不害怕。

sentences.english: Remaining vultures grab slabs of softened gristle and greedily devour them.
sentences.chinese: 禿鷲們奪取了軟骨的厚片，貪婪地吞噬了它們。

definition: amphibious/dual-talented/able to work in two different lines
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
